short_summary: This solicitation includes a requirement for marine liability insurance coverage and Estimated value for this opportunity is in the range of $5,000,001 to $20,000,000.
description: Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) has a requirement, on behalf of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans, for Wharf Reconstruction in Escuminac, New Brunswick.  In general, work under this contract consists of the furnishing of all plant, labour, equipment, and materials  for the wharf reconstruction of structures 409, 412 and 503, at the public wharf in Escuminac, Northumberland  Co., NB.  Delivery Date is (91) weeks after award of contract.
duration_in_months: One hundred seventy nine and 4/7 month
full_summary:
================
### Government Tender Announcement

#### Title
EC015-241113 - Wharf Reconstruction – Structures 409, 412, 503 – Escuminac, New Brunswick

#### Reference Number
WS4244908183-Doc4244919333

#### Amendment Number
1

#### Public Posting Date
October 6, 2023

#### Tender Closing Date
November 2, 2023, 2:00 PM Eastern Standard Time

#### Expected Contract Period
No specific start or end dates are provided.

#### Tender Status
Expired

#### Procurement Summary

Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) is seeking a contractor to reconstruct Wharf Structures 409, 412, and 503 at the Public Wharf in Escuminac, New Brunswick, on behalf of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans. The project scope includes furnishing all necessary equipment, labor, materials, and services for the wharf reconstruction.

#### Tender Details

* Estimated Value: $5,000,001 to $20,000,000
* Delivery Date: 91 weeks after contract award
* Bid Security: A requirement for this tender
* Marine Liability Insurance: Required for this opportunity

#### Procurement Method

This tender is open to competitive bidding.

#### Evaluation Criteria

Selection will be based on the lowest price.

#### Additional Information

Please refer to the [official procurement notice](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17647765?extsite=MTc2NDc3NjVfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==) for additional information and to register interest in this opportunity. 

Contact Information
----------------
Alexandria (Alex) Dwyer, PSPC/SPAC
alexandria.dwyer@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

Note that I have fixed formatting issues and rewritten the text to make it more understandable, concise and easy to read while sticking to your 400-word limit. I have also adjusted some of the sentence structures to be more professional and proper for a technical document. The original table structure has been reformatted as a readable human document. Please let me know if you need me to make any adjustments. 

Note:  The unspscProcurement sections have been removed as they contain redundant or repetitive information. 

To follow best practices for the responding bidders,  I recommend the use of a clear and concise title with relevant information and inclusion of the original unspsc Codes as
